Package org.proto4j.graph

Interface BracketCellRenderer<E>

Type Parameters:
E - the type of values this renderer can be used for
public interface BracketCellRenderer<E>
Identifies components that can be used as "rubber stamps" to paint the cells in a JBracketView. For example, to use a JLabel as a BracketCellRenderer, you would write something like this: 
  
  class MyCellRenderer extends JLabel implements BracketCellRenderer<Object> {
       public MyCellRenderer() {
           setOpaque(true);
       }

       public Component getBracketCellRendererComponent(
             JBracketView<? extends T> bracketView,
             T value,
             int columnIndex,
             int rowIndex) {

          setText(value.toString());
          return this;
      }
  }
See Also:
JBracketView

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    java.awt.Component getBracketCellRendererComponent​(JBracketView<? extends E> bracketView, E value, int columnIndex, int rowIndex)
    Return a component that has been configured to display the specified value.

  • Method Details

    • getBracketCellRendererComponent

      java.awt.Component getBracketCellRendererComponent​(JBracketView<? extends E> bracketView, E value, int columnIndex, int rowIndex)
      Return a component that has been configured to display the specified value. That component's paint method is then called to "render" the cell.
      Parameters:
      bracketView - the JBracketView we're painting
      value - the value at the given column and row index
      columnIndex - the column index
      rowIndex - the cells row index
      Returns:
      A component whose paint() method will render the specified value.
      See Also:
      JBracketView, BracketUtil
